definition[0]: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country
example[0]: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
example[1]: It took ages to clear customs (=be allowed through customs) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
example[2]: You wonâ€™t be able to take that through customs.
definition[1]: the government department that checks goods coming into a country and collects any taxes on them
definition[2]: the government department responsible for collecting the tax on goods that have been brought into the country and making sure that illegal goods are not imported or exported
example[5]: The shipment had come from Spain and had been tracked by Customs.
example[6]: The pornographic photos, films and books have been seized by Customs officers.
definition[3]: the place at an airport or port through which people and goods arriving in a country must pass and where any tax owed must be paid
example[7]: If you go over the limit you have to pay duty when you go through customs.
example[8]: The balance will be paid only after goods have cleared customs (=been checked by customs officials).
